result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Joseph Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: in lieu of $453 costs; Consecutive to 60 days but Concurrent with Prison sentence in 2009CF1789

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Joseph Pearson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Joseph Pearson in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 60 days RCJail, Concurrent with 09CF1789, Prison, Restitution is on case 09CF1789; $453 costs, 10 days Jail in lieu of costs, Consecutive to this but Concurrent with 09CF1789; 0 days credit.

Defendant Michael Joseph Pearson in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant Michael Joseph Pearson in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Michael Joseph Pearson in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Michael Joseph Pearson in court in custody with attorney Joshua H. Klaff.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Warrant vacated.   Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
No contact with any Woodmans in Rock County.
